before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"2fd1c","text":"Make sure all materials and reagents needed for this protocol are available","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2v2m6","text":"This protocol is meant to provide researchers with a step by step procedure on how to prepare glycerol stocks in order to preserve and store bacteria for long term. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1da8t","text":"Bacterial glycerol stocks are important for long-term storage of plasmids. The addition of glycerol stabilizes the frozen bacteria, preventing damage to the cell membranes and keeping the cells alive. A glycerol stock of bacteria can be stored stably at -80°C for many years and -20°C for several months.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1b2h0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"322k8","text":"Glycerol reduces the harmful effects of ice crystals on bacteria which cause dehydration and damage cells through a localised increase in salt concentration leading to the denaturation of proteins. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aa5m7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"fgdle","text":"This protocol describes the steps in preparing bacterial glycerol stocks. This protocol can be performed by anyone with basic molecular biology skills.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Glycerol stocks, Bacteria stocks, Bacteria glycerol stocks, Store bacteria

Broth (with or without antibiotic) ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jnb6","text":" ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cfs38","text":"Sterile Distilled water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3k313","text":"Bacteria(E. coli) strain of interest (from a LB Agar plate)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76bt9","text":"Antibiotic stock of choice (if required)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5euq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acieb","text":"Equipment and 1.5 mL Eppendorf tubes or cryo-tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3us1r","text":"P-1000 micropipette","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4k11k","text":"Sterile 1000 uL pipette tips","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gc2j","text":"50 mL Erlenmeyer flask","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6o0et","text":"Inoculation wire syringe","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9dvd","text":"Sterile 3 mL plastic dropper","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7idmv","text":"Sterile 50 mL falcon tube","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78mtt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkmbl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17j0f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":1,"cas_number":"56-81-5","guid":"43712778341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Glycerol","public":0,"rrid":"","sku":null,"stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":null,"vendor":{"affiliation":null,"affiliations":[],"badges":[],"blocked_by_you":false,"blocked_you":false,"hide_following":false,"id":298,"image":{"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_verified_user":false,"link":"https://www.sigmaaldrich.com/","name":"Sigma entries.section: Diluting Pure Glycerol to 50% with Distilled water

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: From the plate to a PBS eppendorf
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9u8mp","text":"If you have colonies already growing in a Petri dish you can simply collect them using an inoculating wire loop and transfer to a eppendorf tube with     of 1x PBS","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":151,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"21nt2","text":"Once you have collect enough pure colonies you can go to the next step.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"443F8CA011BD11ED8E7ABFB1260010FE","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: Diluting Pure Glycerol to 50% with Distilled water
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a9tvl","text":"Use a clean measuring cylinder to measure  of distilled water and equal amount   of   into a 50 mL falcon tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":42,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":79,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":84,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"72sfb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"338k3","text":"Cork the tube and shake thoroughly until the liquids are evenly mixed","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3uog","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"5B678450D11211EC94DF2DEF6D3C406B","id":"90891","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"5E10AB50D11211EC94DF2DEF6D3C406B","id":"90892","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":0,"cas_number":"56-81-5","guid":"43712726341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","in_steps":null,"linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Glycerol","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"","url":"","vendor":{"id":17,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"http://sigmaaldrich.com","name":"Sigma Aldrich"}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7dpq9","text":"Use a 20 mL sterile syringe to aspirate the 50% glycerol from the falcon tube ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13hdj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0qn2","text":"Plug in a 0.2 µM micro filter and filter out the glycerol into a sterile falcon tube","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9i6ob","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fadpv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Aliquoting the bacterial culture into 50% glycerol and storing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8l07u","text":"To make 1mL of Bacteria glycerol stocks, aliquot  of the filtered 50% glycerol into separate 1.5 mL Eppendorf tubes (triplicates or more depending on the quantity of glycerol stocks needed.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7oiaq","text":"Use sterile micropipette and tips to measure out equal volumes ( ) of the bacterial culture from the Erlenmeyer flask into the tubes containing the 50% glycerol (We now have equal proportion of bacteria and 50% glycerol).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":64,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"36gu8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2t0lo","text":"Keep your thumb pressed firmly against the lid of the Eppendorf tube and  shake vigorously to make sure the 2 liquids mix completely.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1j46b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqlgu","text":"Use a marker pen to label the tubes with the name of the bacterial strain and date of preparation of the glycerol stock","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99k81","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d24pv","text":"Store the vials in the freezer at -20°C until they are used.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dh6nc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ff845","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6jrvb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ua5q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"443F8CA011BD11ED8E7ABFB1260010FE","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"4EA3A550D06311ECB0120F1B58CF07B4","id":"90893","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3ist8","text":"After pipetting the bacteria culture and 50% Glycerol, shake several times to ensure it mixes completely and uniformly.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"82n4m","text":"Bacteria glycerol stocks prepared and stored in this manner are stable for up to year.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cuk0e","text":"Avoid frequent freeze-thaw of the glycerol stocks.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"582t4","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
